{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Associate Manager, Corporate Finance",
  "description": "Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.&nbsp; Greenlight&rsquo;s Sun King&trade; products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Associate Manager, Corporate Finance

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Reporting To: Sr. Manager - Investor Relations
Department: Finance &amp; Legal

About The Role


	Sun King is looking for a Corporate Finance Associate Manager, to join its Finance team in Nigeria.
	The Corporate Finance Associate will provide both operational and strategic support to the organization by supporting the senior management in all strategic and tactical matters relating to corporate finance activities including but not limited to Financial model, forecasting, compilation of documents required for covenant reporting, debt raising and investors requirements.


Responsibilities
Debt Financing &amp; Investor Relations:


	Manage existing debt investor relationships and support in identifying new funding opportunities.
	Liaise with senior management of potential debt investors for fundraising initiatives.
	Participate in debt terms negotiations, documentation, and compliance monitoring.
	Lead due diligence processes for fundraising activities.
	Handle post-drawdown reporting and covenant management.


Financial Modelling &amp; Analysis:


	Develop, maintain, and analyze financial and valuation models.
	Provide insights and recommendations on financial performance, investment opportunities, and risk.
	Support corporate finance strategy including securitization and debt structuring.


Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Prepare financial documents, reports, investor presentations, and proposals using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI.
	Compile and maintain electronic data rooms for fundraising projects.
	Deliver periodic reports on financial covenants and fundraising progress.


Risk &amp; Compliance Management:


	Monitor forex exposures and implement risk mitigation through hedging strategies.
	Ensure compliance with financial covenants and reporting requirements.
	Support grant management and related reporting.


Strategic Advisory &amp; Projects:


	Provide ad hoc support on M&amp;A deals, corporate restructuring, and potential IPO initiatives.
	Partner with internal teams to align on financial strategies and fundraising objectives.
	Assist the Senior Manager, Investor Relations in all strategic investor-facing activities.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	Have Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or its equivalent in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in corporate finance, impact funding, financial services or investment banking.
	Professional qualification ICAN required; ACCA/CFA is a strong advantage).
	Proven skills in financial modelling, debt financing, and investor relations.
	Solid knowledge of profit &amp; loss reporting, fundraising, and securitization.
	Good writing and presentation skills with full proficiency in Microsoft Office and analytics tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI).
	Experience with financial reporting, covenant management, and due diligence processes.
	Highly analytical with good level of attention to detail.
	Self-motivated and able to work without supervision.
	Excellent people, listening, and negotiation skills.
	Adaptable to a fast-paced, multicultural work environment.
	Willingness to travel frequently.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-11",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-12",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Greenlight Planet"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

Associate Manager, Corporate Finance Job at Greenlight Planet




        
    

        
        Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Greenlight’s Sun King™ products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Associate Manager, Corporate Finance
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Reporting To: Sr. Manager - Investor Relations
Department: Finance & Legal

About The Role


	Sun King is looking for a Corporate Finance Associate Manager, to join its Finance team in Nigeria.
	The Corporate Finance Associate will provide both operational and strategic support to the organization by supporting the senior management in all strategic and tactical matters relating to corporate finance activities including but not limited to Financial model, forecasting, compilation of documents required for covenant reporting, debt raising and investors requirements.


Responsibilities
Debt Financing & Investor Relations:


	Manage existing debt investor relationships and support in identifying new funding opportunities.
	Liaise with senior management of potential debt investors for fundraising initiatives.
	Participate in debt terms negotiations, documentation, and compliance monitoring.
	Lead due diligence processes for fundraising activities.
	Handle post-drawdown reporting and covenant management.


Financial Modelling & Analysis:


	Develop, maintain, and analyze financial and valuation models.
	Provide insights and recommendations on financial performance, investment opportunities, and risk.
	Support corporate finance strategy including securitization and debt structuring.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Prepare financial documents, reports, investor presentations, and proposals using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI.
	Compile and maintain electronic data rooms for fundraising projects.
	Deliver periodic reports on financial covenants and fundraising progress.


Risk & Compliance Management:


	Monitor forex exposures and implement risk mitigation through hedging strategies.
	Ensure compliance with financial covenants and reporting requirements.
	Support grant management and related reporting.


Strategic Advisory & Projects:


	Provide ad hoc support on M&A deals, corporate restructuring, and potential IPO initiatives.
	Partner with internal teams to align on financial strategies and fundraising objectives.
	Assist the Senior Manager, Investor Relations in all strategic investor-facing activities.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	Have Bachelor’s Degree or its equivalent in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in corporate finance, impact funding, financial services or investment banking.
	Professional qualification ICAN required; ACCA/CFA is a strong advantage).
	Proven skills in financial modelling, debt financing, and investor relations.
	Solid knowledge of profit & loss reporting, fundraising, and securitization.
	Good writing and presentation skills with full proficiency in Microsoft Office and analytics tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI).
	Experience with financial reporting, covenant management, and due diligence processes.
	Highly analytical with good level of attention to detail.
	Self-motivated and able to work without supervision.
	Excellent people, listening, and negotiation skills.
	Adaptable to a fast-paced, multicultural work environment.
	Willingness to travel frequently.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Controller",
  "description": "A Consortium of leading supply chain companies invites qualified, dedicated, and motivated individuals to apply for various warehouse positions within our operations teams in Lagos and Abuja.

As part of our continued effort to strengthen public health supply chain efficiency, we are recruiting candidates with a strong sense of responsibility, integrity, and commitment to operational excellence to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Controller

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja and Lagos

Duties and Responsibilities


	Responsible for the efficient use of Supply for the management of health commodities, stored in the warehouse and ensure accurate stock reporting is generated for management and Clients on agreed timelines.
	Lead and manage the inbound and outbound Officers in carrying out their functions on mSupply expeditiously to ensure receiving and dispatch processes are done in accordance with Good Warehouse Practices and Good Distribution Practice.
	Lead on all inventory management activities in the warehouse including but not limited to inventory reports, routine bin verification, bin to bin transfer, stock movement, batch consolidation, spot checks, cycle counts, full stock count, etc.
	Provide technical support to the Warehouse Supervisor to ensure all physical ware house inventory activities are aligned with mSupply.
	Collaborate with the MIS/IT Manager to ensure the smooth functioning of mSupply and enhanced functionality development together with the software developer to meet Client requirements.
	Support the MIS/IT Manager to oversee the administration of the access control and CCTV System in the warehouse.
	Work with the Warehouse Supervisor to plan resources required for receiving and storing inbound shipments based on advance shipping notice received from the Clients.
	Ensure that receiving reports are sent to Clients on agreed timelines.
	Ensure total compliance with relevant SOPs by the warehouse and inventory teams, follow up on all incidents or non-conformances recorded, for satisfactory resolution of all corrective and preventive actions (CAPA).
	Conduct pre and post LMD review meetings in conjunction with the Warehouse Operations Manager and share report with senior management.
	Ensure compliance with all relevant SOPs in discharge of your duties.
	Successful candidates will play a key role in supporting the effective management, storage, and dispatch of commodities, ensuring timely and accountable delivery in line with industry and organizational standards.


Qualifications, Experience and Skills


	First Degree (Preferably Computer Science), Master&#39;s Degree an advantage. Certifications in Health Commodity Logistics.
	Minimum 5 years of post NYSC experience.
	Experienced in Warehouse &amp; Distribution operations of health commodities. Knowledge of Quality Management System.
	IT Hardware Management desirable.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter&nbsp;to:&nbsp;warehouserecruitmentng@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-11",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Consortium"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

Inventory Controller Job at Consortium




        
    

        
        A Consortium of leading supply chain companies invites qualified, dedicated, and motivated individuals to apply for various warehouse positions within our operations teams in Lagos and Abuja.

As part of our continued effort to strengthen public health supply chain efficiency, we are recruiting candidates with a strong sense of responsibility, integrity, and commitment to operational excellence to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Controller

Job Locations: Abuja and Lagos

Duties and Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for the efficient use of Supply for the management of health commodities, stored in the warehouse and ensure accurate stock reporting is generated for management and Clients on agreed timelines.
	Lead and manage the inbound and outbound Officers in carrying out their functions on mSupply expeditiously to ensure receiving and dispatch processes are done in accordance with Good Warehouse Practices and Good Distribution Practice.
	Lead on all inventory management activities in the warehouse including but not limited to inventory reports, routine bin verification, bin to bin transfer, stock movement, batch consolidation, spot checks, cycle counts, full stock count, etc.
	Provide technical support to the Warehouse Supervisor to ensure all physical ware house inventory activities are aligned with mSupply.
	Collaborate with the MIS/IT Manager to ensure the smooth functioning of mSupply and enhanced functionality development together with the software developer to meet Client requirements.
	Support the MIS/IT Manager to oversee the administration of the access control and CCTV System in the warehouse.
	Work with the Warehouse Supervisor to plan resources required for receiving and storing inbound shipments based on advance shipping notice received from the Clients.
	Ensure that receiving reports are sent to Clients on agreed timelines.
	Ensure total compliance with relevant SOPs by the warehouse and inventory teams, follow up on all incidents or non-conformances recorded, for satisfactory resolution of all corrective and preventive actions (CAPA).
	Conduct pre and post LMD review meetings in conjunction with the Warehouse Operations Manager and share report with senior management.
	Ensure compliance with all relevant SOPs in discharge of your duties.
	Successful candidates will play a key role in supporting the effective management, storage, and dispatch of commodities, ensuring timely and accountable delivery in line with industry and organizational standards.


Qualifications, Experience and Skills


	First Degree (Preferably Computer Science), Master's Degree an advantage. Certifications in Health Commodity Logistics.
	Minimum 5 years of post NYSC experience.
	Experienced in Warehouse & Distribution operations of health commodities. Knowledge of Quality Management System.
	IT Hardware Management desirable.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: warehouserecruitmentng@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

Laboratory Assistant Job at Ganfeng Lithium Industry Limited




        
    

        
        Ganfeng Lithium Industry Limited is a mining company engaged in the exploration, mining, and processing of lithium. With a strong presence across the country, the company operates branches in Lagos, Abuja, and Nasarawa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Laboratory Assistant
Job Location: Keffi, Nasarawa
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are looking for a reliable and hardworking Lab Assistant to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for picking and handling samples and assisting with general laboratory activities.


Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Minimum of O’Level qualification
	Must be detail-oriented, organized, and punctual
	Ability to follow instructions and work efficiently
	Previous experience will be an added advantage.


Benefits


	Salary: N70,000 – N90,000 monthly
	Accommodation provided
	Attendance bonus
	Performance bonus.


Method of Application 
Interested and qandidates candidates should send their CV to: ganfenglithiumindustrylimited1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Assistant",
  "description": "A consortium of leading supply chain companies invites qualified, dedicated, and motivated candidates to apply for various warehouse positions within our operations teams in Lagos and Abuja in the capacity below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Slot: 6

Duties and Responsibilities


	Perform physical receipt by ensuring proper stock handling during offloading of trucks, sorting, palletizing and racking of stock in the warehouse.
	Prepare the physical blind receipt report for the shipment.
	Carry out physical picking, staging, checking and dispatching orders including supervising loading of dispatch vehicles.
	Responsible for the documentation of all inbound and outbound records in the warehouse, also responsible for maintaining soft record of the documentation.
	Participate in stock count exercises including spot checks, cycle counts, full stock counts and bin verifications.
	Responsible for Good House Keeping of the warehouse in accordance with Good Warehouse Practice by ensuring the cleaners carry out their task in line with service level agreement.
	Report and document incidents within 24 hours.
	Perform all warehouse operations in accordance with approved standards.
	Perform all warehouse operations in accordance with EHS guidelines.
	Carry out any other task that may be assigned by the Warehouse Supervisor.


Qualifications, Experience and Skills


	Minimum of SSCE Certificate.
	At least 5 years of experience in Pharma Grade Warehouse including Cold Chain Products.
	Certification in Warehousing &amp; distribution.
	Knowledge of mSupply inventory management software (added advantage).
	Fluency in written &amp; oral English.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter&nbsp;to:&nbsp;warehouserecruitmentng@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Consortium"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja, Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "188678"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Warehouse Assistant Job at Consortium




        
    

        
        A consortium of leading supply chain companies invites qualified, dedicated, and motivated candidates to apply for various warehouse positions within our operations teams in Lagos and Abuja in the capacity below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Slot: 6

Duties and Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Perform physical receipt by ensuring proper stock handling during offloading of trucks, sorting, palletizing and racking of stock in the warehouse.
	Prepare the physical blind receipt report for the shipment.
	Carry out physical picking, staging, checking and dispatching orders including supervising loading of dispatch vehicles.
	Responsible for the documentation of all inbound and outbound records in the warehouse, also responsible for maintaining soft record of the documentation.
	Participate in stock count exercises including spot checks, cycle counts, full stock counts and bin verifications.
	Responsible for Good House Keeping of the warehouse in accordance with Good Warehouse Practice by ensuring the cleaners carry out their task in line with service level agreement.
	Report and document incidents within 24 hours.
	Perform all warehouse operations in accordance with approved standards.
	Perform all warehouse operations in accordance with EHS guidelines.
	Carry out any other task that may be assigned by the Warehouse Supervisor.


Qualifications, Experience and Skills


	Minimum of SSCE Certificate.
	At least 5 years of experience in Pharma Grade Warehouse including Cold Chain Products.
	Certification in Warehousing & distribution.
	Knowledge of mSupply inventory management software (added advantage).
	Fluency in written & oral English.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: warehouserecruitmentng@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Assurance Pharmacist",
  "description": "A Consortium of leading supply chain companies invites qualified, dedicated, and motivated individuals to apply for various warehouse positions within our operations teams in Lagos and Abuja.

As part of our continued effort to strengthen public health supply chain efficiency, we are recruiting candidates with a strong sense of responsibility, integrity, and commitment to operational excellence to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Pharmacist

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja and Lagos

Duties and Responsibilities


	Responsible for the registration of the premise with Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN).
	Ensure that all SOPs are up to date and reviewed at expiration or when there is any change in process or develop new SOP for new process.
	Collaborate with the Quality Assurance Lead in the design and implementation of efficient and effective Quality Management Systems (QMS) in the Warehouse.
	Provide leadership in the management of cold chain products in the warehouse.
	Ensures the compliance of the warehouse to Environment, Health &amp; Safety as well as Good House Keeping Practices.
	Drives Change Control and Deviations Process by ensuring appropriate documentations e.g. Change Control documentation and Non-Conformance Logbook.
	Monitor the implementation of all Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPA) arising from internal or external quality audits of the warehouse.
	Ensure that all incidents are promptly reported, logged, investigated and resolved through corrective and preventive action management approach.
	Ensures that Temperature reports, Humidity reports, Pest Control reports, House keeping reports and Incident reports are kept up to date.
	Undertake the inspection and sampling of commodities in accordance with relevant SOPs or Client requirement.
	Manage and ensure compliance with in-house training matrix.
	In conjunction with the Warehouse Operations Manager, lead the reception for any visit by Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN), National Agency for Drug and Food Administration and Control (NAFDAC) or other regulatory authorities and FMOH&amp;SW representatives.
	Conduct quarterly self-audit for each of the warehouses and consolidate the reports by highlighting open issues for management review, as well as follow up on all the open issues to ensure full closure.
	Attend review meetings with Clients on all quality related matters.
	Perform other duties that may be assigned by the Quality Assurance Lead.


Qualifications, Experience and Skills


	B.Pharm or Doctor of Pharmacy mandatory. MSc Supply Chain or Public Health would be an added advantage.
	5 - 7 years of experience in private or public health supply chain management. Knowledge of storage, packaging, handling and transportation of pharmaceutical products including temperature sensitive and biological products.
	Experience in Quality Assurance functions as it relates to GDP and Quality Management Systems.
	Intermediate/Advanced computer skills to include the use of MS Office packages.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter&nbsp;to:&nbsp;warehouserecruitmentng@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-11",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Consortium"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja, Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "188677"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,

    }

}



Quality Assurance Pharmacist Job at Consortium




        
    

        
        A Consortium of leading supply chain companies invites qualified, dedicated, and motivated individuals to apply for various warehouse positions within our operations teams in Lagos and Abuja.

As part of our continued effort to strengthen public health supply chain efficiency, we are recruiting candidates with a strong sense of responsibility, integrity, and commitment to operational excellence to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Pharmacist

Job Locations: Abuja and Lagos

Duties and Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for the registration of the premise with Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN).
	Ensure that all SOPs are up to date and reviewed at expiration or when there is any change in process or develop new SOP for new process.
	Collaborate with the Quality Assurance Lead in the design and implementation of efficient and effective Quality Management Systems (QMS) in the Warehouse.
	Provide leadership in the management of cold chain products in the warehouse.
	Ensures the compliance of the warehouse to Environment, Health & Safety as well as Good House Keeping Practices.
	Drives Change Control and Deviations Process by ensuring appropriate documentations e.g. Change Control documentation and Non-Conformance Logbook.
	Monitor the implementation of all Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPA) arising from internal or external quality audits of the warehouse.
	Ensure that all incidents are promptly reported, logged, investigated and resolved through corrective and preventive action management approach.
	Ensures that Temperature reports, Humidity reports, Pest Control reports, House keeping reports and Incident reports are kept up to date.
	Undertake the inspection and sampling of commodities in accordance with relevant SOPs or Client requirement.
	Manage and ensure compliance with in-house training matrix.
	In conjunction with the Warehouse Operations Manager, lead the reception for any visit by Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN), National Agency for Drug and Food Administration and Control (NAFDAC) or other regulatory authorities and FMOH&SW representatives.
	Conduct quarterly self-audit for each of the warehouses and consolidate the reports by highlighting open issues for management review, as well as follow up on all the open issues to ensure full closure.
	Attend review meetings with Clients on all quality related matters.
	Perform other duties that may be assigned by the Quality Assurance Lead.


Qualifications, Experience and Skills


	B.Pharm or Doctor of Pharmacy mandatory. MSc Supply Chain or Public Health would be an added advantage.
	5 - 7 years of experience in private or public health supply chain management. Knowledge of storage, packaging, handling and transportation of pharmaceutical products including temperature sensitive and biological products.
	Experience in Quality Assurance functions as it relates to GDP and Quality Management Systems.
	Intermediate/Advanced computer skills to include the use of MS Office packages.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: warehouserecruitmentng@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.
